UI_visible_response: The #MeToo movement is an awareness movement centered around the issue of sexual harassment and sexual abuse, particularly of women in the workplace2. It was founded in 2006 by Tarana Burke, an advocate for women in New York, who initially coined the phrase to support survivors of sexual violence, particularly young women of color from low-wealth communities3. The movement gained significant momentum in 2017, largely through social media platforms like Twitter, where it spread virally after detailed descriptions of unwanted sexual experiences were publicly shared and labeled as sexual assault7. This societal reckoning empowered millions of women to speak out about the sexual violence they had experienced4.
traffic_visible_response: The #MeToo movement is an awareness movement centered around the issue of sexual harassment and sexual abuse, particularly of women in the workplace [[2]]. It was founded in 2006 by Tarana Burke, an advocate for women in New York, who initially coined the phrase to support survivors of sexual violence, particularly young women of color from low-wealth communities [[3]]. The movement gained significant momentum in 2017, largely through social media platforms like Twitter, where it spread virally after detailed descriptions of unwanted sexual experiences were publicly shared and labeled as sexual assault [[7]]. This societal reckoning empowered millions of women to speak out about the sexual violence they had experienced [[4]].
